metadata.title: CVE-2019-11735 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Mozilla developers and community members reported memory safety bugspresent in Firefox 68 and Firefox ESR 68. Some of these bugs showedevidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort thatsome of these could be exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerabilityaffects Firefox < 69 and Firefox ESR < 68.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11735` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 69.0.1+build1-0ubuntu2
firefox-geckodriver - 69.0.1+build1-0ubuntu2
firefox-mozsymbols - 69.0.1+build1-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '69.0.1+build1-0ubuntu2').
mozjs52 package in esm-apps/focal is affected and may need fixing.
